metadata.title: CVE-2022-41318 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A buffer over-read was discovered in libntlmauth in Squid 2.5 through 5.6.Due to incorrect integer-overflow protection, the SSPI and SMBauthentication helpers are vulnerable to reading unintended memorylocations. In some configurations, cleartext credentials from theselocations are sent to a client. This is fixed in 5.7.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-41318` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.14
squid-cgi - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.14
squid-common - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.14
squid-purge - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.14
squid3 - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.14
squidclient - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.14
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid3 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.27-1ubuntu1.14').
